name: Starting Git
description: "Git is software for tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development. Git was created by Linus Torvalds in 2005 for development of the Linux kernel." - Wikipedia, 2021.

question.insert: What is Git?

answer.insert: A snapshot of the state of all files in git

answer.insert: The result of applying a SHA-1 function on a text

answer.insert: The directory with a copy of the repository

question.insert: What is index / staging?

answer.insert: File (or area) that contains all information about the next commit

It's really important to configure your name and email, because each commit uses this information to immutably _______ all _______ made by you

What is the difference between the command

git config --global user.name "Git Master"

and the other command

git config user.name "Git Master"

answer.insert: With --global, your credential is stored forever in your local system

question.insert:
What is the goal of the following command

git config --global user.name "Git Master"

answer.insert: To configure - globally - the git user as "Git Master"

question.insert:
What is the goal of the following command

git config --global user.email git.master@provider.com

answer.insert: To configure - globally - the git email as "mestre.do.git@provedor.com.br"

question.insert:
What is the goal of the following command

git config --global core.editor emacs

answer.insert: To configure - globally - the default git text editor

question.insert: What is the command to list all git configurations?

What is the output of the following command
git config user.email

answer.insert: Displays the user email saved in git
